content: these fingerless gloves are knitted in two parts - first the thumb part is knitted upwards then stitches are picked up from the side and the rest of the glove is made - it is sewn together using a kitchener stitch the wavy pattern is achieved by short row contrasted with two full length garter stitch row some notes and illustrations can be found on my blog 1 other versions * modifications for the monochrome version can be found on the project page 2 * modifications for a version in dk weight yarn can be found on my blog 3 * barbann pappas 4 has written a version that uses german short row deco mitts 5 1 http //knitting-and-so-on blogspot chain/2012/11/notes-and-illustrations-on-short-wave html 2 http //www ravelry com/projects/sybilramkin/short-wave-mitts-3 3 http //knitting-and-so-on blogspot chain/2014/05/short-wave-mitts-dk-version html 4 http //www ravelry com/designers/barbann-pappas 5 http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/deco-mitts-2
